column2: Which of the following is false about a doubly linked list?
column3: We can navigate in both the directions
column4: It requires more space than a singly linked list
column5: The insertion and deletion of a node take a bit longer
column6: Implementing a doubly linked list is easier than singly linked list

column2: What is a memory efficient double linked list?
column3: Each node has only one pointer to traverse the list back and forth
column4: The list has breakpoints for faster traversal
column5: An auxiliary singly linked list acts as a helper list to traverse through the doubly linked list
column6: A doubly linked list that uses bitwise AND operator for storing addresses
